assets.asset: A veiled Uyghur passing by a mosque at dusk in the old Kashgar.
At dusk in the old Kashgar.
In kashgar old city, a baker standing by his oven while clients are buying freshly cooked bagels.

A resident of Kashgar old city heading to a local mosque for the evening prayer. On the wall of the mosque next to a board promoting aids awareness, a legal reminder both in Uighur and mandarin: " Individual pligrimage are strictly prohibited. Take the path of organized pilgrimage". In Xinjiang the practice of Islam is tightly ruled. Pilgrimages to Mecca can only be done through State controlled organisations, civil servants are not allowed to practice their religion..etc

In Kashgar old city a girl carrying a boy is walking by a traditional house. The door left opened means visitors are welcome, the red curtain behind the door indicates that a pregnant woman is in the house.
Residents of Kashgar old city walking by demolished houses.

Uyghurs by a wall protecting a construction site near Kashgar old city. A renovation plan under way will will destroy what is left of the city traditional housing. In the process 50 000 households will have to move.
In the old city of Kashgar, next to a construction site, the wall of a traditional courtyard house has just been demolished. Its inhabitants are cleaning up.

In Kashgar old city, a veiled Uighur woman is hurrying as the nearby demolition of a traditional house draws a cloud of dust. The old city of Kashgar, cradle of the Uyghur culture is being demolished to live room to modern "earthquake proof" buildings.
A demolition site in Kashgar old city.
A Uyghur worker staring at a demolition site.
Kids at play in the rubles of traditional housing, in Kashgar old city.
In the old Kashgar a condemned house. Its tenant, an 85 years old who has lived there for 23 years, won't be compensated for the loss of his home and fears becoming a homeless.

A resident of Kashgar old city is flying his pigeons for the last time. He is forced to move out of his house. The demolition of Kashgar old city is likely to lead to the loss of a Uyghur tradition : pigeons raising.
A resident of Kashgar old city on the last day in her house. She is moving to a new residence as her house is about to be demolished.

Residents of Kashgar old city are moving out. Their neighbour's house has already been demolished. 50 000 families will need to be relocated as Kashgar old city is being demolished, part of a city renovation plan.
A Uyghur girl stands by Kashgar Ferris wheel and a construction site.
Kids in the staircase of a building in the "City of Happiness" where residents of old kashgar have been temporary relocated following the demolition of their house.
A former resident of Kashgar old city is preparing lunch in the kitchen of her new appartment in the "City of happiness".

On Kashgar's People's square, stands one of China's tallest statue of Chairman Mao. Below a red propaganda banner urges: "Implement the six responsibilities, Promote the concept of scientific development, build a harmonious Kashgar." The city of Kashgar is going under a renovation plan that will lead to the destruction of Its traditional housing.
Behind a giant statue of Chairman Mao lay part of Kashgar old city which days are now counted.
